entry.title: Just A Bit Broken
entry.summary:
Author: stereksupremacy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,865Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 31

Summary: Derek-The moment my eyes see Stiles I knew he was mine. Now it was just a matter of letting him see we were basically meant for each other. It shouldn't be too hard... Or will it? With too many obstacles between us, his brother included, is my love enough to win him over? They say love is hard, but how hard is too much? It doesn't matter. I will keep trying and trying even if it breaks me little by little. Stiles deserves love, and I will be the one to give it to him.Stiles-My life was turned upside down the day my mother got custody of me during the divorce. It's a subject we don't want to talk about. Ever. From there, things just got worse, so now. New town, new me. I won't let anyone close to me. Everyone in the end just hurts me and I don't think my heart, or my mental health can handle any more betrayals. So when Derek comes knocking on my cold, dead heart, I have to build higher and stronger walls. Because truth be told, I don't think I can keep saying no to him. But I have to. No matter how charming he is. Or how funny. Or how insanely hot he is. He'll just end up hurting me. Like him. The one who shall not be named. I'm not made for love. I learned that the hard way. Derek will have too as well.

entry.title: Written All Over Your Face
entry.summary:
Author: Blahblahblahblah9

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,478Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 26

Summary: Stiles wasn’t pouting, he wasn’t. Sat in the corner of the plush sofa at the Hale house, his arms crossed over his chest and eyebrows furrowed together, he wasn’t pouting. Derek was allowed to have other friends, now that he had started school, but Derek was still his, only his.It didn’t feel like it right now though as Derek sat in between his friends, playing video games and laughing. Stiles had never had to share Derek’s attention before, and he decided he didn’t like it. or, Stiles is jealous that Derek has new friends and isn't paying attention to him. Derek reassures Stiles that he loves him the most.

entry.title: This Is Not Me Falling for You (Except It Definitely Is)
entry.summary:
Author: Hathly

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,324Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 287

Summary: “HALE! THIS ISN’T A MODELING GIG, STOP POSING AND THROW THE DAMN BALL!”And for just a second, Derek falters.Not visibly. Not enough for anyone else to notice. But Stiles sees it—the tiny twitch in his shoulder, the flick of his eyes toward the stands. He felt that. He heard him.Stiles grins, high on adrenaline and something he refuses to name.This? This is their thing. This is fine.And any other fluttery, ridiculous thought trying to take root in his chest?He shuts the door on it.Hard.Because he doesn’t like Derek.He can’t.It would be stupid. And dangerous. And asking for disaster.

entry.title: DOUBLESPEAK & SUBTERFUGE
entry.summary:
Author: knox_rivers

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,782Chapters: 13/18Kudos: 29

Summary: After a series of events are erased from public memory, Stiles returns to Beacon Hills Prep with a fractured reputation and a growing power. Meanwhile Scott is having trouble reconciling the pressure and expectations from his estranged fathers–Rafael–sudden return.As the school restructures and supernatural tensions rise, old alliances are tested, new leaders emerge, and hidden agendas begin to surface. With friendships strained and the political balance shifting, Stiles and Scott are drawn deeper into a world of rituals, legacy, and dangerous expectations. Stiles also begins training under a reluctant mentor when he uncovers truths about the past and his role in a future that others are quietly trying to shape.Meanwhile, forces inside and outside the school maneuver to gain control, and the line between protector and pawn begins to blur. When violence erupts and loyalties are tested, Stiles must decide who he is, who he stands with, and what he’s willing to become to survive what’s coming next.Some power is inherited. Some is stolen. But the most dangerous kind? The uncontrollable.

entry.title: Heyoka
entry.summary:
Author: hikyuu

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,047Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 71

Summary: Stiles is struck by lightning then some weird things happen. He remembered the lightning game he and Scott used to play as kids, counting the seconds between lightning and thunder to estimate the storm's proximity. By his calculations, the storm was directly overhead—thunder following lightning by less than a second. By their childish logic, the eye of the storm was less than a mile away. Stiles runs faster. He was nearing Derek’s house when it happened. The hairs on his arms stood on end, his ears buzzed, and his fingertips tingled. He had read and watched enough of “I Shouldn’t Be Alive” to know exactly what this meant. What he didn’t know was what he should do. Should he stop? Run? Take cover? Did lightning follow movement? Should he drop to the ground? Roll? He kept running. Derek’s house was just ahead. If he could make it— A deafening boom rang out, and Stiles’ vision went white. Pain engulfed him, as though his body were ablaze.

entry.title: Copain of the black wolf.
entry.summary:
Author: EverythingRara

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 125,736Chapters: 14/40Kudos: 160

Summary: A Sterek rewrite of the show, that stays mostly canon compliant in the beginning, shown exclusively through the eyes of Stiles Stilinski, unknown soul mate of Derek Hale.Starts slow emotionally, my first attempt at a story of this degree please be gentle.Stiles grunted softly as he heaved himself onto the roof, his sneakers scuffing against the shingles. Scott—his best friend since forever—wasn’t answering his phone, and Stiles couldn’t wait. There was no way Scott was going to believe what Stiles had just overheard.Keeping low, Stiles crept along the roof toward Scott’s window, his heart racing as the cool night air pressed against his skin. He tried the window, but it wouldn’t budge—it was locked.“Of course it’s locked,” he muttered under his breath, rolling his eyes.Knocking softly on the glass, he leaned in closer, squinting to peer inside. The curtains were drawn, giving him only a hazy, distorted view of the room beyond. “Scott,” he hissed, rapping on the window again. No answer.Suddenly, the curtains shifted, and the window flung open. Scott and Stiles screamed, startling each other.
